A 'metaphosphate' ion is an oxyanion that has the empirical formula
PO 3âˆ’ . The structure of a
metaphosphate ion can be described as being made up of PO 4
structural units in which each unit shares two corners with another unit.
This can come about in two ways.
* Formation of a ring, as in trimetaphosphate, illustrated.
* Formation of an infinite chain, with the same structure as in ammonium
  metavanadate
